title: What did Native American Indians eat? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: You need to be more specific when you say “Native American.” In Alaska alone, within my lifetime, we had twenty distinct native languages spoken-InupiaqSiberian YupikCentral Alaskan Yup’ikAlutiiqUnangaxDena’inaDeg XinagHolikachuk (No fluent speakers remain)KoyukonUpper KuskokwimGwich'inTananaUpper TananaTanacrossHanAhtnaEyak (No native speakers remain)TlingitHaidaTsimshian These twenty languages represent seven broad cultural traditions-AthabascanEyakHaidaTlingitTsimshianUnanganInupiaq/Yupiq/Cu’piq Those seven cultural traditions can be further pigeonholed into four categories with varying degrees of usefulness: “Pacific Northwest Cultural Regions” (Eyak, Haida, Tlingit, Tsimshian)“Eskimos” (Inupiaq/Yupiq/Cu’piq)“Aleut” (Unagan)Athabascan So, in Alaska you have at least four broad culinary traditions based upon what was regionally available, prepared based upon differing traditions. As you expand to the entirety of the Americas, the question gets even broader.

It had to be as varied as the topography, environment that grew on their particular portion of land, water sources, and available wildlife. The Americas is made up of two continents. North America stretches from Panama to the North Pole. South America stretches from Colombia to Tierra Del Fuego. About the only foods unavailable would be those that were not indigenous to the Americas before first contact. They ate the local produce and wildlife in their area.
